What book is The movie A Bell for Adano based on?

The movieA Bell for Adano is based on the bookA Bell for Adanowritten byÂ  John Hersey

A Bell for AdanoPublished by Vintage - 6/26/2019

This classic novel and winner of the Pulitzer Prize tells the story of an Italian-American major in World War II who wins the love and admiration of the local townspeople when he searches for a replacement for the 700-year-old town bell that had been melted down for bullets by the fascists. Although stituated during one of the most devastating experiences in human history, John Hersey's story speaks with unflinching patriotism and humanity.

Related books / From the author(s)

A Bell for Adano

written byJohn Hersey

Published by Vintage - 6/26/2019

This classic novel and winner of the Pulitzer Prize tells the story of an Italian-American major in World War II who wins the love and admiration of the local townspeople when he searches for a replacement for the 700-year-old town bell that had been melted down for bullets by the fascists. Although stituated during one of the most devastating experiences in human history, John Hersey's story speaks with unflinching patriotism and humanity.

A Bell for Adano

written byJohn Hersey

Published by New York : Bantam Books - 1/1/1946

An Italian-American major, part of American occupation forces in Sicily during World War II, tries to reform the town in his charge by being decent to people. His efforts are epitomized by his efforts to replace the 700-year-old bell melted down for bullets by the fascists.

A Bell for Adano

written byPaul Osborn

1/1/1945

An Italian-American major, part of American occupation forces in Sicily during World War II, tries to reform the town in his charge by being decent to people. His efforts are epitomized by his efforts to replace the 700-year-old bell melted down for bullets by the fascists.

A Bell for Adano

written byJohn HerseyandProfessor John Hersey

Published by Important Books - 1/1/2013

The story on an Italian-American major who wins the love and admiration of a small Sicilian village when he tries to repalce the 700-year-old town bell that was melted down by the Fascists.

A Bell for Adano

written byJohn Hersey

1/1/1952

Did you know that the movie A Bell for Adano is based on the book A Bell for Adano?

Major Joppolo and his men are assigned to restore order to the war-torn Italian town of Adano. He has to manage getting supplies into town without interfering with troop movements, all the while dealing with colorful citizens of the town. One of his quests is to replace the bell which orders the town's life.
